qas.question: What type of elevators are used in the Taipei 101 office tower?
During what hours is the lower deck turned off?
During the low volume hours, what can the upper deck function as?

answers.text: a single-level elevator stopping at all adjacent floors

qas.question: On what floor must restaurant customers clear their reservations?

answers.text: at the reception counter on the 2nd floor

qas.question: What levels make up the "sky lobby"?

context: <a0_0>Double deck elevators<a0_0/> are used in the Taipei 101 office tower. Tenants of even-numbered floors first take an escalator (or an elevator from the parking garage) to the 2nd level, where they will enter the upper deck and arrive at their floors. The lower deck is turned off during <a1_0>low-volume hours<a1_0/>, and the upper deck can act as <a2_0>a single-level elevator stopping at all adjacent floors<a2_0/>. For example, the 85th floor restaurants can be accessed from the 60th floor sky-lobby. Restaurant customers must clear their reservations <a3_0>at the reception counter on the 2nd floor<a3_0/>. A bank of express elevators stop only on the sky lobby levels (<a4_0>36 and 60, upper-deck car<a4_0/>), where tenants can transfer to "local" elevators.
